page.title: 09Soft Fruit at Leadon Court
page.content: Mr. Kannreuther has three fields of{blackcurrants.} One field was replanted last year (1984), and these bushes will not be picked until 1987. The bushes fruit for 15 years and then the field is rested for 3 years to give the soil time to recover its structure. The bushes are pruned in spring by hand so that they will be sufficiently uniform to be{picked by {machine.} The blackcurrants are all exported to Holland by lorry as soon as they are picked. It is important to pick at exactly the right time, since only 5% of green currants is allowed, but if the fruit is too ripe the machine crushes it to pulp as it picks. At present, Mr. Kannreuther has difficulty in getting a good price because of competition from Poland.
